body:
Hi all,



I'm working with HB. After the simulation with **000_gettingStarted_with_honeybee** I've checked the **.bat** file to see what I did with Radiance. Here I've found something that for me (a newbie of this world) appear strange, that is the **rpict** command run two times with the same parameters to obtain the same output (**.unf)**.** **

I can't understand the usefulness of this step. Why HB works in this manner?   



Thanks for your help,

Giuseppe.

replies.body:
Hi Giuseppe,



This is called "overture". Check John Mardaljevic's slides (62-67) for a really good explanation about what is overture and why it helps for a better rendering with Radiance: [http://www.radiance-online.org/community/workshops/2011-berkeley-ca...](http://www.radiance-online.org/community/workshops/2011-berkeley-ca/presentations/day1/JM_AmbientCalculation.pdf)



Hope it helps,

Mostapha

Hi Mostapha,



Very helpful information, as always. Thank you for the slides.



Regards,

Giuseppe
